intro: Racosperma flocktoniae, commonly known as the Flockton's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and bipinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in compact, globular clusters. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance through its deep root system. Racosperma flocktoniae is often found in rocky outcrops and open woodlands, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
